debug.description: Use 'ns debug' instead of 'ns run'. Defaults to true

device.description: Device identifier to run app on.

emulator.description: Explicitly run with an emulator or simulator

uglify.description: Enable uglify during the webpack build

release.description: Enable release mode during build using the --release flag

forDevice.description: Build in device mode using the --for-device flag

production.description: Build in production mode using the --env.production flag

copyTo.description: When building, copy the package to this location.

prepare.description: Starts a Webpack compilation and prepares the app's App_Resources and the plugins platforms directories. The output is generated in a subdirectory for the selected target platform in the platforms directory. This lets you build the project for the selected platform.

provision.description: (iOS Only) When building, use this provision profile name.

aab.description: (Android Only) When building, create an Android App Bundle (.aab file).

keyStorePath.description: (Android Only) When building, use the keystore file at this location.

keyStorePassword.description: (Android Only) When building, use this keystore password.

keyStoreAlias.description: (Android Only) When building, use this keystore alias.

keyStoreAliasPassword.description: (Android Only) When building, use this keystore alias password.

combineWithConfig.description: Used with platform targets (ios|android) to share build configurations.

fileReplacements.description: Replace files with other files in the build.

flags.description: Extra flags to pass to the NativeScript CLI (e.g. '--env.config=myapp'). You can separate multiple flags by spaces and use '=' to join option/values (e.g. '--env.config=myapp --env.appComponents=myCustomActivity.ts

id.description: App bundle id. Use with configurations that desire a specific bundle id to be set.

plistUpdates.description: Update any .plist value. Specify name of any filename with key/value pairs, e.g. { 'Info.plist': { CFBundleDisplayName: 'MyApp' } }. Defaults to look in App_Resources/iOS/{filepath} however you can specify relative path if located elsewhere.

xmlUpdates.description: Update any .xml value. Specify name of any filename with key/value pairs, e.g. { 'src/main/res/values/strings.xml': { app_name: 'MyApp', title_activity_kimera: 'MyApp' } }. Defaults to look in App_Resources/Android/{filepath} however you can specify relative path if located elsewhere.

force.description: If true, skips the application compatibility checks and forces npm i to ensure all dependencies are installed. Otherwise, the command will check the application compatibility with the current CLI version and could fail requiring ns migrate.
